general_advisory: Cloudy weather is expected in upcoming days so farmers are advised to take precautionary measures to keep the harvested produce in a safe place. Regular monitoring against various diseases in field and vegetable crops is recommended. Sowing of Rabi crops and nursery sowing of Rabi Paddy should be completed. Deworming and vaccination in animals is advised for boosting immunity and disease protection.

advisory: Stop irrigation in the field before harvesting if rice is at maturity stage.
Harvest when 80-85% of the grains have matured and the plant looks pale yellow in color.
Dry harvested rice in the field for 2-3 days and then thresh it. Store rice at a moisture level of 12% in safe places.
Regular monitoring for False Smut disease infestation in late maturing rice varieties.
Spraying of Copper hydroxide 77% @ 2g/ltr or Tebuconazole 25% @ 2g/ltr if infestation is noticed. Repeat spray after 7-10 days.
Treat seeds with carbendazim and imidacloprid one week before sowing.
Mix Rizobium culture and sodium molybdate in seeds and dry before sowing.
Sow seeds with spacing of 30cm×10cm.
Varieties include Kamadeva, Durga, IPM 02-3, IPM 02-14, TARM1.
Treat seeds with carbendazim and imidacloprid one week before sowing.
Mix Rizobium culture and sodium molybdate in seeds and dry before sowing.
Sow seeds with spacing of 30cm×10cm.
Varieties include Prasada, Usala, PU 31, IPU2-43, Mahuri.
Perform thinning operation to maintain optimum plant population in mustard.
Hoeing and weeding operations for 15 to 20-day-old crops.
Use improved Groundnut varieties for sowing.
Ensure seed treatment before sowing and treat with bacteria or phospho culture after 7 days.
Sow seeds at a depth of 5cm.
Conduct gap filling where seedlings have not emerged.
Use polythene or straw for mulching during planting.
Regular monitoring against Diamond back moth in cauliflower.
Provide proper protection and clean drinking water to livestock during winter season.
